content.raw:
Sorry this happen sometimes when I'm testing the new changes. Two quick solutions to stop the SPAM:
  * Look for the `dsl` job which generates the jobs, probably the last run used an specific branch of release-tools (no default). Run it with default should disable new jobs created from the dev branch.
  * It could happen (like this time) that default branch does not contain a dsl job. Disable manually the jobs that are continuously failing is a perfect valid option. Nothing will be removed.
content.html: Sorry this happen sometimes when I'm testing the new changes. Two quick solutions to stop the SPAM: * Look for the dsl job which generates the jobs, probably the last run used an specific branch of release-tools (no default). Run it with default should disable new jobs created from the dev branch. * It could happen (like this time) that default branch does not contain a dsl job. Disable manually the jobs that are continuously failing is a perfect valid option. Nothing will be removed.
